name: Bel-Ami Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a great hotel in a magnificent location, can't get any better my opinion. If everything is OK, then this is great, but if you are planning a special occasion visit, beware, you might be disappointed. We went there for our 10th anniversary honeymoon. During our whole 10 days stay, the next door apartment was being renovated, which meant, that the smell of plaster, the banging and seesawing started at 9 and would go on through the day. My each complain was net with - yes we could move you, but its going to stop tomorrow. Never did so. I have noticed, that in general this is a great place, but the hotel lives its own life and if it ruins someones holiday, they really don't care, so again, if you are planning something special, a romantic trip, just beware it can be ruined in this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, don't care for guests

reviews.text: We stay around the corner from the Bel Ami and noticed that they have a spa facility now that is available to non-guests. We went in to book treatments directly with the spa but no one was around at 11 am so went to the concierge who booked us in for the next day and took our credit card numbers to guarantee the treatments. Imagine our surprise when we arrived to find out the bookings were for the wrong day. The woman at the spa acted like it was our fault and the concierge, well, he shrugged his hands in the air. As we were spending 200 euro with the spa, it would have been nice if there had been even a sincere apology. We've considered staying at the Bel Ami but certainly not now.
reviews.title: Neither gracious nor organised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is simply not worth booking into this hotel because despite the boutique hotel prices, you still run the risk of being next door to people who keep you awake because of the paper thin walls and the very small rooms. The hotel has not been designed well enough to ensure that noise from other rooms doesn't travel. To be honest, I think you would have been able to almost make out the words of people speaking in the next room if they had just been speaking in normal voices - we, unfortunately had the pleasure of being next to people who yelled obscenities at each other and slammed doors for most of the duration of their (and our stay), irrespective of the time of day or night.
reviews.title: Perfect location - but don't risk wasting your money

reviews.text: We foolishly put up with it for one night but on our last night had to call the Duty Manager at 2.30 am and again at 6am to intervene – essentially turning our planned restful stay in Paris into a nightmare. I expected that when I went downstairs to speak to the Manager in the morning that she would have been ready and waiting with not only an apology but some sort of recompense – no matter how small. But no, nothing – all she said was that she would speak to the couple. To top it off, she didn’t realise we were checking out that day and actually said that she would ‘think about moving us’. I can assure you that if we had been staying another night, we would have demanded a different room : we didn’t pay £220 per night to be kept awake by the people in the next room. As it was I strongly advised her not to put anyone else in our room that evening – heaven knows if she paid attention or even cared.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: In short - it is no good just looking like a boutique hotel, Bel Ami – you also need to operate like one. Had the Manager thought to recompense us, even in some small way, we might have thought that this was just a one off, and that these awful people were not the calibre of the usual Bel Ami guest. Her lack of response suggested to me that maybe this was not a one off. Given our dreadful experience and the lack of good management of it, we won’t ever be staying there again.
reviews.title: lovely hotel, helpful staff, beautiful location!

reviews.text: I would like to commend the staff and management of Bel-Ami in Paris. My husband and I were travelling with our 3-month old baby and therefore had some extra requests. Whenever I contacted the hotel via email the appropriate person responded quickly and in a very friendly manner. They organised a crib for the baby and also a transfer from the train station. Upon arrival two staff members saw the provate car and came straight out and down the street to help with our baggage.
reviews.title: Superior service provided from the moment I booked

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very modern and clean, located just down the road from the famous Le Deux Maggots cafe in Saint Germain. Breakfast was wonderful and the staff kept filling the empty trays and bowls, even just before breakfast was suppose to end.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in excellent place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very quiet with respect to street noise. The bed and pillows were wonderful. The bathroom very clean. The only downside was the room size. Even though we had upgraded to a superior it was still quite small. However this is unstandable given the fantastic location on the hotel and reasonable prices.
reviews.title: A delightful find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have spent 3 nights in this hotel and all we can say it is wonderful place to stay. Very modern design, friendly staff, nice rooms and breakfast. Bit of advice: rooms overlooking a street might be noisy, although traffic is not that intensive. We enjoyed that staff spoke our language and is very well trained. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. We walked on foot everywhere from Louvre to Musee Rodin...
reviews.title: Great location - good safe bet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a week at the Hotel Bel Ami and we couldnt be more pleased with our stay. Firstly, the location is great. In the heart of the 6th arrondissement, surrounded by great cafes and restaurants, and constant activity. Note that the hotel itself is on a quieter street so it is not noisy at all. The hotel is lovely! The rooms have 4 different color themes which you can request when you book the room. We stayed in the superior room which was a very good size and definitely worth the extra cost considering how expensive this area is. The staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful and gave us some great restaurant recommendations. The hotel has a very modern feel to it and is very romantic. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back!
reviews.title: 5 stars for location, 4 stars for staff and breakfast, 3 stars for room colour, OVERALL 4 stars

reviews.text: I booked four rooms for four nights over New Year for my family. Did the booking over the internet. No problems.
reviews.title: A great experience

likes.liked: — Location, Friendly Helpful staff, Comfortable clean rooms

reviews.text: The location is wonderful in Saint Germain des Pres. I think this is the best part of Paris. It is near the Seine and has all the wonderful Bistros and Brasseries of the Left Bank. The hotel is only a very short walk to the St Germain Metro station. The rooms were delightful. Not large by Asian or Australian standards but big enough and well designed and nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — I was happy with the hotel. No complaints.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly. They worked hard before we arrived to arrange somewhere for us to spend New Years Eve and they provided on-going assistance throughout the stay.
reviews.title: Paris for New Years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere is very relaxed and my family enjoyed its stay here enormously.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great People

reviews.text: The Hotel Bel Ami is a great place to stay in Paris. The location is perfect. You are within walking distance of a lot of Paris's sites and some really great Cafes, such as Cafe Flores. The rooms are clean and comfortable and appropriate for the price of the room.
reviews.title: Great location, horrible organization! BEWARE DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CC!

likes.disliked: — administration and erroneous wake up call at 5am

reviews.title: Great place, great people, great location
reviews.text: If you want to be in the middle of everything in Paris this is a great choice. Its well situated for the Metro or you can walk to many things. Yet its off the busy St Germain Blvd so you give up some noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was flawless. I loved all the Duravitt and Hansgrohe in the bathroom. 2 flat screens and an IPod radio. This is not your standard US chain hotel room.
reviews.title: Loved the Bel-Ami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was so very pleasant and able to help us with all those mindless tourist questions. I especially appreciated the free internet access in the lobby.
reviews.title: Loved The Bel Ami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually had a suite and could not have been happier. I would certainly stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: WILDLY over-rated - BEWARE!

likes.liked: — Staff were very capable, friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — Dull Dull Dull, titchy room, over-priced

reviews.text: Stayed at the Bel-Ami for 4 nights in August. Could't have been more pleased. Great location, friendly helpful staff, very clean accomodations - nice boutique hotel. Room was small, which was expected for Paris, but not tiny - never was an issue for my wife and I who were in Paris on our Honeymoon.
reviews.title: Fantastique!

description: The Bel-Ami, member of Design Hotels, ideally located between the Flore and Deux Magots, has its heart beats in rhythm with Saint Germain des Prés. Rooms and Suites casual chic, Spa Esthederm and trendy bar.
